page.title: 01FARMLAND AND FOREST
page.content: A rural area of farmland and forest encompanying part of Savernake Forest and several smaller woods. These are old, deciduous woods, with some conifers managed by the Forestry Commission. The ten farms are mainly arable with some permanent flocks of sheep and some 'imported' in winter to graze land later cropped by cattle. The London to Bath A4 road crosses from East to West carrying a steady, but not heavy, volume of traffic. Two areas of habitation are Chisbury, developed round a minor cross road and a tiny community at St. Katharines. Other houses are scattered singly or in pairs. Thoser not housing local workers have been sold to business, professional or retired people who either live and work within travelling distance or use them at weekends. South of Chisbury is an Iron
